body:
Comment 5 by **atarski**: 
I agree that much could be done at the level of a library. For many things this would
even be more flexible, apart from some performance critical bits. But a language
level change is necessary if you want to have complex number literals written in the
standard notation (using i or j as root -1). Also the basic math ops (+,-,*,/) would
need to operate on complex numbers - right now they are overloaded to work seamlessly
on the various int and floating point types; I believe it would make sense to extend
this to cmplx, cmplx32, cmplx64. 

I recall that python did not have complex numbers for many years - they were added
only when numeric-python (the ancestor of numpy/scipy) started taking off.
